column4: in /etc/apache2/mods-enabled, you can see the dir.conf enabled? That is where the various index files are mentioned
like "DirectoryIndex index.html index.cgi index.pl index.php index.xhtml index.htm"
hm I simply added these strings into httpd.conf and apache2.conf but after restart it had no effect
maybe I shouldn't write <ifModule> tags there
there is no need to change httpd.conf.
okay, ill check that file you said
see/use the /etc/apache2/sites-enabled and/or modules-enabled and/or conf.d etc. The httpd.conf is just your basic config
oh okay, thanks a lot, i have some experience under windows, but here it's a bit different I see)

by default, the index.php should be used as index, if it exists. Alternatively you could add "DirectoryIndex index.php" to your /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default (if that is the site you are working on)
do I need to use tags like <IfModule dir_module> there?
you could, but since that is loaded by default, it is not required
you can enable/disable modules by using a2enmod / a2dismod
your command would be "a2enmod rewrite" (and restart apache)
